pullRequest.body:
This instance should make things easier to read and avoid defeq abuse. That is, given a term `x : PiLp p Œ±` (or for instance `x : EuclideanSpace ùïú n`), we can ensure that Lean interprets this is a function by writing `‚áëx`. This shouldn't be a `FunLike` instance because then the coercion `‚áë` would get unfolded to `FunLike.coe` instead of `WithLp.equiv`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I suggested this to Jon, so I won't merge it myself.

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.

> This shouldn't be a FunLike instance because then the coercion ‚áë would get unfolded to FunLike.coe instead of WithLp.equiv.

Can you put this comment in the source code for future readers?
@eric-wieser: I included the suggested comment. Thanks!
@j-loreaux : I added the suggested quotation marks.
Great. When you complete the changes, as you just did, you should mark the PR `awaiting-review` again.
@JonBannon it seems the work from your other PR infected this. Can you remove the bit about `Matrix.toEuclideanLin`?

Sure. Sorry! I must have pushed the wrong branch.

On Sun, Apr 7, 2024, 1:15 PM Jireh Loreaux ***@***.***> wrote:

> @JonBannon <https://github.com/JonBannon> it seems the work from your
> other PR infected this. Can you remove the bit about Matrix.toEuclideanLin
> ?
>
> ‚Äî
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11943#issuecomment-2041534838>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOJJJTROS4KCTVD5YIOAOU3Y4F5K5AVCNFSM6AAAAABF2PXKFSVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDANBRGUZTIOBTHA>
> .
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8607199082/job/23587255132)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8607199082/job/23587254580)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8607199082/job/23587254962)
bors r+
bors r+

```suggestion
/-The following should not be a `FunLike` instance because then the coercion `‚áë` would get
unfolded to `FunLike.coe` instead of `WithLp.equiv`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `CoeFun` Instance for `PiLp`

source.title: chore(Analysis/Normed/Lp/ProdLp): Add WithLp.fst and -.snd to avoid defeq abuse
